channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration.

item.title: Report X-2023110365
item.description:
Report X-2023110365

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-15T15:11:35+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-03
  • City: MESA
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: THE DESIGNATED RESPONDER WAS NOTIFIED ABOUT A LEAKING HAZMAT IN THE PRELOAD OPERATION. WEARING THE APPROPRIATE PPE DOMINIC COLORAD, THE DESIGNATED RESPONDER WENT TO THE LOCATION OF THE SPILL FOR CLEAN UP. PLACING THE LEAKER IN A LINED SPILL TRAY AND UTILIZING THE DECISION TREE AND RESPONSE SHEET. THE RESPONDER THEN RETURNED WITH THE PACKAGE/DEBRIS TO THE DAMAGE CAGE FOR FURTHER INSPECTION.

item.title: Report I-2023110011
item.description:
Report I-2023110011

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-16T18:13:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-14
  • City: Dallas
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: SOUTHWEST AIRLINES CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Aircraft was being boarded when passenger sitting in seat 16C noticed smoke coming from their fanny pack. They stood up but could not exit the aircraft because passengers were still boarding and isle way was congested. Passenger passed the fanny pack to other passengers until the fanny pack was thrown in the jetway and doused with water by a deadhead flight attendant. When smoking had ceased and device was cooled down, it was removed. Flight continued to board and departed. Photos upon request.

  • Description: While cargo agent was unloading from baggage cart at the cargo facility, the cargo agent felt the liquid on his hands when removing. Agent washed hands with warm soapy water. Package was bagged in a plastic bag to prevent further leakage on other materials. No leak was seen or noticed on aircraft.

item.title: Report I-2023100036
item.description:
Report I-2023100036

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-16T18:13:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-11
  • City: Cincinnati
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: SES-R1 LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Pallet of 4 x 55 gallon steel drums were being removed from a van trailer. When the forklift operator went to back out of the trailer, the pallet failed due to the weight of the drums. When the pallet broke, 1 of the drums tipped against the wall of the trailer and liquid started leaking out of from the ring of the lid. Roughly 2.5 gallons leaked out into the trailer for a period of about 30 seconds. The warehouse associate was able to upright the drum and the leak stopped. Forklift operator and warehouse associate placed spill pads on the floor and soaked up the free liquids, and wiped down the back of the trailer. Upon further inspection of the drum, the lid was removed and revealed that it did not contain a gasket.

DescribePack: There is a white fiberboard box with with a brown fiberboard box on the inside that contained the bottles of alcohol. There was nothing wrong with the packaging; the only problem was that the cap to one of the bottles had come loose, which caused the spill. After tightening the cap nothing more was leaking out. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Absorbent material was placed around the spill to contain the leak, and the package was placed in a tote with absorbent pads.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: DURING THE UNLOAD PROCESS THE MANAGER NOTICED THAT THE PACKAGE WAS UPSIDE DOWN AND THAT IT WAS ALSO WET. MANAGER IMMEDICATELY TOOK PACKAGE OVER TO THE HAZMAT CAGE TO PROPERLY SECURE AND VENTILATE PACKAGE. I WAS THEN CALLED OVER TO START THE REPACK PROCESS. DescribePack: THE BOX ITSELF WAS UPSIDE DOWN, ARROWS FACING THE WRONG DIRECTION AND EVERYTHING. TWO OF THE FOUR BOTTLES ON THE INSIDE WERE ALSO FACING THE WRONG DIRECTION. ONE OF THE FOUR BOTTLES HAD A LOOSE CAP CAUSING IT TO LEAK. APPROXIAMTELY 2 CUPS OF DISINFECTANT LEAKED OUT ONTO CAUSING THE BOX TO BE ALL WET AND START RIPPING APART. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: MANAGER TAKING PACKAGE IMMEDICATELY OVER TO THE HAZMAT CAGE TO SECURE AND VENTILATE IT AND THEN CALLING ME OVER. I THEN REPACKED THE PACKAGE INTO A YELLOW SALVAGE DRUM SAFELY AND IN A TIMELY MANNER.

  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was inbound scanned at 0433. At approximately 0510 QA was called to unload managers desk by baydoor 12. QA was notified that HazMat package appeared to be leaking and that their was a strong smell emanating from package. Upon inspection it was found that one of the two items in the package had a loose top that allowed some of its inner contents to spill out. HazMat was placed in a salvage drum and moved to QA1 to process post sort. DescribePack: 2 items were found in the package. 1 was a gallon of paint and the other was a gallon of paint thinner. The lid on the can of paint thinner was loose and allowed some of its contents to spill out. Lower right corner of outer packaging appears to have a regangle shaped wet mark of about 3 x 5 inches. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: As soon as QA identified that the package was indeed a damaged HazMat the item was placed in a salvage drum, picked up from the unload and brought to QA1 to be processed post sort.

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Pile of Ecolab hazmat packages found 5:30pm on Trailer 954036 from 755 MESQ on Door 82 of the small unload. Plastic 5 gallon drum of Ecolab Built Detergent was found upside down and when placed upright it was discovered lid seal was leaking. The package was placed in a lined red tote and removed from operations posthaste. DescribePack: Lid seal consistently leaking on all sides of the packaging. The drum was found upside down, suggesting internal corrosion of the inner seal. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PPE donned. Package and spillage were placed in a lined and lidded red tote for transport to the HMPA. Care was taken to separate this hazmat from another leaking hazmat of Sodium hypochlorite solution within the same trailer.

All contents were placed inside of a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report X-2023100470
item.description:
Report X-2023100470

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-16T18:13:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-09
  • City: SEATTLE
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 10/8/2023 at approximatley 2000, Dangerous Goods Adminstration received a call from Employee 5433639 at the ramp facility in Seattle, reporting a undeclared corrosive shipment. The shipment consistes 16 bottles of Carpet stair remover. The shipment discovered leaking during loading. A safety data sheet found online revealed that the contents is classified as UN3265. The shipment was not prepared in accordance with IATA regulatoions, as it was without markings, labeling, packaging and paperwork. The shipment is being held, pending an investigation from the FAA.

item.title: Report E-2023100581
item.description:
Report E-2023100581

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-15T15:11:35+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-10
  • City: NEW JOHNSONVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 1
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 10/10/2023, at 1754 hours, personnel in the CSXT New Johnsonville, Tennessee Yard discovered GATX5945, a loaded tank car of Sulfuric Acid, leaking from top of the car. The car was isolated and the shipper, Veolia, was notified via CHEMTREC (Report # 2023-10-10-00231). Marion Environmental Inc. (MEI), a CSXT response contractor, was dispatched to the scene and found a pressure relief vent with a blown rupture. While replacing the rupture disc on the car, contractor personnel also determined that the pressure relief device was not equipped with the required hydraulic surge protection. Contractor personnel removed the blown rupture disk and installed a new 2 SS 165 psi rupture disk, decontaminated the exterior of the tank car to ensure no hazardous residue was present as a result of the release, and remediated the environmental impact to the track area. All issues identified and corrective actions were communicated to the shippers representative- Jeff Humphries. As a result of this release, a CSX employee was splashed with liquid was released from the car during normal switching operations. The employee was able to removing the impacted clothing and decontaminate themselves; the employee refused any medical treatment.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was soaked from leaking in transit inside trailer 831413 from Hagerstown Hub. Package was in upper half section of trailer, on top of trailer flaps, instead of floor level. Some spillage occurred immediately surrounding the package, but was wiped up with appropriate procedure and precautions without any injury. DescribePack: Contents leaked due to an unsecured cap from the inner container. May have twisted loose due to lack of packing material or knocked loose from jostling in transit. Outer fiberboard box lost integrity from being soaked at the top. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Surrounding area of package was wiped thoroughly to remove all visible residue. Hub may wish to inspect top of trailer flap on middle of the right side for any remaining residue from package before further use.

Report X-2023100481

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-15T15:11:35+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-03
  • City: LYNNFIELD
  • State: MA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: THE PACKAGE WAS DAMAGED IN THE UNLOAD BY ANOTHER LEAKING PACKAKE. IT WAS TRANSPORTED TO THE REWRAP TABLE ON THE SOUTH SORT BOTTOM SLIDE TO BE REWRAPPED. THERE, THE REWRAP PERSON NOTICED THERE WAS AN AEROSOL CAN IN THE PACKAGE WITHOUT ANY HAZMAT MARKINGS ON THE OUTSIDE OF THE BOX. THE PACKAGE WAS THEN BROUGHT TO THE DMP AREA FOR FURTHER UNDECLARED PROCESSING.

item.title: Report X-2023100480
item.description:
Report X-2023100480

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-15T15:11:35+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-03
  • City: LYNNFIELD
  • State: MA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SORTER ON THE SOUTH SORT AISLE NOTICED PACKAGE WAS TORN OPEN AND THAT IT CONTAINED 3 AEROSOL CANS IN THE PACKAGE. SORTER NOTIFIED A SUPERVISOR WHO THEN CHECKED OUT THE PACKAGE AND CALLED FOR A DESIGNATED RESPONDER. THE RESPONDER SAW THE THREE AEROSOL CANS IN THE PACKGE WITH NO OUTER HAZMAT MARKINGS. THE PACKAGE WAS THEN TRANSPORTED TO THE DMP AREA FOR FURTHER UNDECLARED PROCESSING.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On October 26, 2023, one (1) 5-gallon container of UN3098 was punctured while in transit and released approximately five (5) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Safety and Health Consulting Services (ES&H) to remediate the impacted site. ES&H personnel deployed granular absorbents to the UN3098-impacted trailer and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents and debris were collected and containerized into two (2) 55-gallon drums. The damaged pail of product was placed into one (1) 55-gallon drum. All containers were staged onsite for future disposal.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On October 26, 2023, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN1219 was crushed in a load shift and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the pallet. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from SET Environmental (SET) to remediate the impacted site. SET personnel utilized absorbent wipes to remediate the isopropyl acetate from the impacted drum. Crews then plugged the punctured 55-gallon drum and containerized it in one (1) 85-gallon overpack for transport back to the R+L Edinburgh, Indiana Terminal.

item.title: Report E-2023110115
item.description:
Report E-2023110115

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-14T18:12:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-13
  • City: SALEM
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On October 13, 2023, two (2) 5-gallon pails of UN3266 were damaged due to a load strap failure and released approximately seven (7) gallons of product to the trailer interior and concrete. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. A pH test was performed before remediation and a neutral reading was confirmed. An on-site forklift was used to remove all cargo from the trailer for better access to the spill. The damaged pails were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal purposes. FCE personnel deployed absorbent boom around a nearby drain as a precautionary measure during remediation activities. Crews deployed granular absorbents and a neutralizing agent to the impacted area and worked them in with hand tools. All UN3266-impacted material was containerized in one (1) additional 55-gallon drum for disposal.

EWI personnel containerized the damaged pail in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal. All UN3266-impacted material was containerized in one (1) additional 55-gallon drum for disposal.

  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 10/04/2023 at approximatelty 1207, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 475551 at the station location in Costa Mesa, reporting a non-hazardous spill. The shipment consisted of one fiberboard box, containing a Throttle Body air intake cleaner at 12 ounces, Prestone power steering fluid at 32 ounces, Purple power cleaner and degreaser trigger spray at 40 ounces, and Purple Power cleaner and degreaser liquid at 1 gallon, which leaked partially. Further investigation revealed that the Throttle Body air intake cleaner is an aerosol container that was being shipped under the Limited quantiy exception under FedEx Extra Hours program. The shipment is being held for further disposition instructions.

item.title: Report X-2023100704
item.description:
Report X-2023100704

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-13T18:12:55+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-07
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A FULLY LABELED HAZMAT PACKAGE WAS DISCOVERED BY AN UNLOADER IN UNLOAD C THAT APPEARED TO BE WET AND STAINED ON THE OUTER CARTON. THE UNLOADER VACATED THE AREA, NOTIFIED HIS SUPERVISOR AND A DMP RESPONDER ARRIVED WITHIN 5 MINUTES DONNING THE PROPPER PPE. FOLLOWING THE DECISION TREE AND CORRECT RESPONSE SHEET, IT WAS DETERMINED THAT THERE WAS NO LEAKAGE OUTSIDE OF THE CARTON AND THE PACKAGE WAS TRANSPORTED BACK TO THE DMP. UPON FURTHER INSPECTION, ONE OF THE INNER VESSELS WAS FOUND TO HAVE A LOOSE CAP BY 3/4 OF A TURN AND APPROXIMATELY 3 OUNCES OF LIQUID HAD ESCAPED AND LEAKED ONTO THE OUTER CARTON. THERE WAS NO INTERNAL PACKING MATERIAL AND THE OUUTER CARTON WAS A SINGLE WALL 120 POUND CAPACITY FIBERBOARD BOX.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: NUMEROUS PACKAGES WERE COLD TO THE TOUCH AND HAD FROST FORMING ON THE OUTSIDE. THESE PACKAGES WERE MIXED IN WITH PACKAGES FROM THE SAME SHIPPER THAT WERE PROPERLY MARKED AS CONTAINING DRY ICE. UPON INSPECTION OF THE INNER CONTENTS OF THE NON-MARKED DRY ICE PACKAGES, WE FOUND APPROXIMATELY NINE KILOGRAMS OF DRY ICE COOLING DOG FOOD IN EACH BOX. THESE THIRTY BOXES ARE MISSING DRY ICE MARKINGS ON THE OUTER BOXES. THE PACKAGES ARE GOING TO VARIOUS CONSIGNEES IN THE USA. THESE PACKAGES HAVE NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO. THESE PACKAGES WERE SHIPPED USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER B37A21, PETCO-JFFD AMERICOLD, 34 FAIRMONT CITY BLVD., NATIONAL STOCK YARDS IL 62071.

item.title: Report X-2023100749
item.description:
Report X-2023100749

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-16T18:13:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-28
  • City: CHICAGO
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: ILLINOIS CENTRAL RAILROAD COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: An FRA inspector observed liquid on the side of tank car # GATX 80428 appearing to be leaking from the manway cover (approximately 1/2 way down the side of the car) while performing a regulatory compliance check at the CN Glenn Yard in Chicago, IL. The inspector notified the CN Dangerous Goods Officer who responded to the incident location. The CN Dangerous Goods Officer's inspection of tank car revealed liquid leaking from the gasket sealing surface between the manway nozzle and the manway cover plate indicating a possible gasket failure. The liquid on the side of the tank car previously noted by the FRA inspector was nearing the bottom side of the tank car when the CN DGO arrived. The nitrogen pad pressure was relieved from the tank car. The manway cover was then opened for gasket inspection purposes. The (6) manway cover swing bolt nuts required a 36" pipe wrench and lubricating oil on the bolt threads to be loosened indicating the cover has not been opened for an extended period of time. The 20" manway cover lid gasket was removed and inspected. The inspection revealed the gasket to be delaminated in several areas and showed signs of deterioration throughout. The lid gasket was replaced with a 20" Teflon rim nozzle gasket and re-secured by the CN DGO. A response contractor decontaminated the tank car exterior and re-applied a nitrogen pad to the interior. The shipper listed on the waybill was notified of the incident through a Chemtrec report. The car will be released for continued transportation pending an OTMA 3 for an un-related defect.

item.description:
Report X-2023100001

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-15T15:11:35+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-15
  • City: GEISMAR
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CANADIAN NATIONAL RAILROAD
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On September 15, 2023, CN transportation crews observed UTLX 130231 (Residue Last Contained / UN 1789 / Hydrochloric Acid / Class 8) venting from the top during a roll-by inspection inbound into Geismar yard. The railcar was isolated, all required notifications made. CN Contractor responded. Upon approaching the railcar, vapors were observed coming from the top. Upon closer inspection, puddled liquid was observed on the pressure plate. The fill hole cover bolts were checked and could be easily turned by a gloved hand. The puddled liquid was tested with ph paper and showed acidic. The fill hole cover bolts were tightened, and the leak was secured. The puddled liquid was neutralized, and the exterior of the railcar was decontaminated. The railcar was released back into transportation and allowed to continue onto destination.

  • Description: on 09/12/2023 at approximately 1845, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 234302 at the hub facility in Newark, reporting an undeclared flammable liquid spill. The shipment is a gas-powered generator, containing a resudue of gasoline. The shipment was discovered due to odor and a stained outer package. The shipment was not prepared as a fully regulated dangerous goods shipment, without having the required marking, labeling, packaging and paperwork, in accordance with IATA regulations. The shipment is being held, pending an FAA investigation.

  • City: Eagan

  • Carrier/Reporter: KANE FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Driver did not notice that this was a vapor-recovery tank even though it was diesel fuel.(Customer took out the mid-grade gasoline product and replaced it with diesel product) The driver failed to lock down the down spout fitting onto the pipe fitting. The tank built up presseure as there was a pressure release vent cap in place, and the least resistanse which was the non-coupled fitting, blew off the pipe fitting, releasing(spilling) product onto the ground. The driver was at the rear of the trailer doing paperwork, rather than at the point of delivery. The fuel ran down hill onto the street and entered the city sewer system. All of the product ran down hill thru the city sewer system about a block and was captured at a holding tank prior to entering a lake. No product entered the lake. Booms where placed and then replaced to collect the spilled product.

  • Description: Driver arrived to deliver a bulk load of VM&P to MFG in Dalton, GA. Customer informed driver that they would complete unload process, driver returned to the cab of his truck. Customer employee began sample taking process and checked that external valve was closed before opening internal valve to take sample. Upon opening internal valve, an estimated quantity of approximately 50 gallons was released unexpectedly out of the hose connection point and into the customers containment area. Probable cause is external valve failure. Tanker will be fully inspected to confirm.
